title.narrative: Developing a UNIDO work-plan for partnering with middle-income countries (MICs)

description.narrative:
As demonstrated by the recent adoption of the UNIDO strategic framework for partnering with middle-income countries (MICs), partnering with MICs is essential to UNIDO’s goal of achieving Inclusive and Sustainable Industrial Development (ISID) globally, through the attainment of Goal 9 (“Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation”) and all the industry-related goals and targets included in the 2030 Agenda. Existing interlinkages among the SDGs and their related targets will ensure the multiplying effect of industrialization on all other areas of development in MICs.
The implementation of ISID policies is not only a central feature for structural economic change of middle-income countries, but also an essential pillar for achieving higher levels of social and environmental standards by the creation of productive capacities opportunities and the implementation of environmentally sustainable policies. UNIDO recognizes the vitally important role played by MICs for achieving poverty eradication globally, and the means to articulate ISID solutions to effectively respond to common industrial development challenges of MICs.
In 2018-2019 UNIDO developed the referred strategic framework for partnering with MICs which was subsequently adopted at the 18th session of the General Conference through resolution GC.18/Res.9. This resolution also included a specific reference on behalf of Member States requesting the Director General to prepare a work plan for the implementation of the strategic framework, to be presented at the forty-eighth session of the Industrial Development Board (IDB). This mandate was reinforced Abu Dhabi Declaration (GC-.8/Res.1) reinforced UNIDO’s mandate to operate in MICs by encouraging UNIDO to “addressing the specific challenges facing middle-income countries”.
